Class Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • Settings

  • public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
    Holds all data for the game which was passed via command line arguments. This includes the InteractionMode of the game, differenced in the Autoplay- and Interactive - Mode, the step delay, the total number of disks in the game and the size of the window.

    That class can only be called with arguments, there is no default constructor.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Settings

        private Settings()
        Constructor without parameters should never be called.

      • Settings

        public Settings(Settings.InteractionMode mode,
                int totalDisks,
                int stepDelay)
        Creates settings with specifying the InteractionMode, the number of Disks and the step delay for the Autoplay-Mode.
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode the game is played with. Options are AUTOPLAY and INTERACTIVE.
        totalDisks - the number of disks in the game.
        stepDelay - time how fast the disks should be moved in the Autoplay-Mode.
